3. The method of claim 1, further comprising: transmitting the unique ID number to the device associated with the user.
4. The method of claim 3, further comprising: transmitting the unique ID number to the device associated with the user after receiving the demographic data for the user.
5. The method of claim 3, further comprising: transmitting the unique ID number to the device associated with the user prior to transmitting the information regarding one or more available coupons.
6. The method of claim 1, wherein the information regarding one or more available coupons is displayed according to category.
7. The method of claim 1, wherein the information regarding one or more available coupons is displayed in response to a search query.
8. The method of claim 1, wherein the information regarding one or more available coupons is displayed based on the user's geographic region.
9. The method of claim 1, wherein the information regarding one or more available coupons is displayed based on the user's demographic data.
10. The method of claim 1, wherein the computer at the retail location comprises a point-of-sale system.
11. The method of claim 1, wherein the unique ID number included with the redemption data is read from a barcode.
12. The method of claim 11, wherein the barcode is printed on the at least one coupon.
13. The method of claim 1, wherein the unique ID number included with the redemption data is read from a frequent shopper card.
14. The method of claim 1, wherein the predetermined number of times specified for the at least one coupon is one.
15. The method of claim 1, further comprising: targeting one or more subsequent coupons for the user based on the received redemption data.

16. A network-based system for distributing coupons, comprising: a database that stores demographic data for a user along with a unique ID number; and a computer, in operative communication with the database, the computer configured to: transmit to a device associated with the user, for display, information regarding one or more available coupons; receive, from a computer at a retail location, redemption data corresponding to at least one coupon presented by the user for redemption at the retail location, wherein the redemption data includes the unique ID number; determine whether a number of times that the at least one coupon has been redeemed by the user is greater than a predetermined number of times specified for the at least one coupon; and deny authorization to further redeem the at least one coupon if it is determined that the number of times that the at least one coupon has been redeemed by the user is greater than the predetermined number of times.
17. The system of claim 16, wherein the demographic data includes one or more of age, income level, marital status, or children present.
18. The system of claim 16, wherein the computer is further configured to: transmit the unique ID number to the device associated with the user.
19. The system of claim 18, wherein the computer is further configured to: transmit the unique ID number to the device associated with the user after receiving the demographic data for the user.

20. The system of claim 18, wherein the computer is further configured to: transmit the unique ID number to the device associated with the user prior to transmitting the information regarding one or more available coupons.
21. The system of claim 16, wherein the information regarding one or more available coupons is displayed according to category.
22. The system of claim 16, wherein the information regarding one or more available coupons is displayed in response to a search query.
23. The system of claim 16, wherein the information regarding one or more available coupons is displayed based on the user's geographic region.
24. The system of claim 16, wherein the information regarding one or more available coupons is displayed based on the user's demographic data.
25. The system of claim 16, wherein the computer at the retail location comprises a point-of-sale system.
26. The system of claim 16, wherein the unique ID number included with the redemption data is read from a barcode.
27. The system of claim 26, wherein the barcode is printed on the at least one coupon.
28. The system of claim 16, wherein the unique ID number included with the redemption data is read from a frequent shopper card.
29. The system of claim 16, wherein the predetermined number of times specified for the at least one coupon is one.
30. The system of claim 16, wherein the computer is further configured to: target one or more subsequent coupons for the user based on the received redemption data.
